official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from granting a work authorization to an alien found
			 to have been unlawfully present in the United States.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Equal Protection for American Workers Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Equal Protection for American Workers Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 prohibited from granting a work authorization to an alien who has been
			 finally determined, in a valid immigration proceeding during which due
			 process was afforded, to have been at any time unlawfully present in the
			 United States.

text.#text: Effective beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4389 IH: Equal Protection for American Workers Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
